title: Essence Reaver: Too little, too late.
body:
So Essence Reaver's been out a few months now, and pretty much everyone has come to the same conclusion and is asking the same questions: Why does a mana sustain item need a BF Sword? What kind of lunatic threw this idea together? Who is obsessed with making it a Bloodthirster replacement? Where does the mana sustain or CDR for this item even come from?

So yeah. ER has kinda...flopped. The high cost, the uncooperative built path, the outrageously high combine cost, the fact that it's just a BT with a few tweaks, nobody cared about it. It doesn't fill the niche it was designed to fill. It has failed as an item.

So what do we do with a failed item? We fix it. We fix it until it works. And we start by taking apart the problem and addressing it. Essence Reaver builds out of BT. That's bad. Replace it with a Pickaxe. Drop the AD to 60. Drop the cost. More easily available. Good to go. Essence Reaver gains CDR and mana sustain out of the ether. That's bad. Add in a Forbidden Idol. Grant 10 Mp5. Stats don't come out of nowhere. More easy to assemble. Good to go.

~~Essence Reaver~~
~~- Pickaxe (875g) + Vampiric Scepter (800g) + Forbidden Idol (700g) + 475g = 2850g~~
~~+ 60 Attack Damage~~
~~+ 10 Mana Regeneration~~
~~+ 10% Lifesteal~~
~~+ 10% Cooldown Reduction~~
~~- Unique Passive - Restores mana on-hit equal to half of the health restored from Lifesteal.~~

EDIT: Been thinking, would be better to further its distance from the niche BT feels so it can be made more slot efficient, so re-reworking it.

**Essence Reaver**
- Vampiric Scepter (800g) + Forbidden Idol (700g) + Dagger (450g) + Dagger (450g) + 600g = 3000g
+ 40 Attack Damage
+ 40% Attack Speed
+ 10 Mana Regeneration
+ 10% Lifesteal
+ 10% Cooldown Reduction
- **Unique Passive** - Restores mana on-hit equal to 5% of the physical damage dealt.

replies.body:
What about positioning it as a pick for the caster/carry instead of as a straight substitute for ANY carry? Give it an easier build path out of two strong mid-game items, and make it a late game powerhouse for carries who rely heavily on spells. Something like this:


**Aether Blade**
*Sapphire Crystal + Longsword + X Gold*

+200 mana
+15 AD
10% CDR
*Unique Passive: *Physical damage returns 2%-6% of physical damage as mana (half on AoE abilities).



**Essence Reaver**
*Aether Blade + Brutalizer + X Gold*

+250 mana
+60 AD
+20% CDR
+25 Armor Penetration

**Unique Passive:** Physical damage returns 2%-10% of damage as mana (half on AoE abilities).


What this gives us is a decent early game item for mana sustain, and a nice build-path for the caster carry (Aether Blade into Brutalizer is actually some really solid early game power, although you lose out on HP sustain). It works with assassins who need mana as well because the mana regen is based on physical damage dealt instead of just on auto-attacks, meaning that Talon and Pantheon and Kha'Zix might also be interested in it.

Late game it gives a pretty solid chunk of AD, along with some wonderful damage boosters for the most caster-focused ADCs: the 20% CDR and high armor penetration are really appealing, especially since Lucidity Boots and offense masteries will allow you to net 40% with just this item, and a number of assassins and caster marksman would really value that.

Whether or not they'd value it ENOUGH to give up the lifesteal and the 20 damage that another item could get them is a different story. That said, I think if you priced this competitively you'd actually have a really solid item choice.
I really like the idea...splitting it in a Tier 1 and an upgrade would make a lot more sense.

I think it still needs the life steal to help it along though. as good as it can be, extra lifesteal helps it be an early item to build. Waiting until late game to complete it doesn't make a lot of since if you're heavily dependent on abilities. The life steal gives the extra sustain for the laning phase.
Completely agree. It needs it's own unique items to build into, and have the Tier system to transition from early/mid game to late game.
Yeah all the item really needs is a decent tier 1 item for laning.
what no, who would fucking want that, its good because it has the stats of a bt. It works fine with graves
Less AD is good for which ADC exactly?
Not being able to buy it during the actual laning phase is good for which ADC exactly?
Do you realize that several ADC's have horrible mana issues AFTER the laning phase? It's great on Ashe, Sivir, Corki. It's not intended to get as a first or even second item.

If you're having mana issues on Ashe late game, turn off your Q for farming for the love of god.

As for Sivir and Corki, why would they not want their mana sustain a tad earlier, again? Because you didn't come up with any actual counterpoint. You just said "There are people for whom mana is relevant by the time ER can be purchased." Which is true...and also irrelevant, because 3 champions is just about 2.5% of all champions in the game, and that means we have an item which is less relevant than *an energy item.*
They definitely would not be able to afford this earlier. You need to drop almost 3k gold to pick this version of the item up, people will just ignore it and build triforce, shiv, etc.

Well, actually, for some ADC, or AD laners, the extra damage from spellcasting that comes from a forbidden idol could very well translate in a lane victory or objectives control.
They reason they don't build it is that Forbidden idol, or any mana item except manamune are irrilevant for them. If they really have mana issues , perhaps even a Sheen is a better option, as it still adds damage and builds into trinity later on.
However, 60 AD , 10 LS, 10% CDR and mana regen?
That essentially becomes a valid alternative to Botrk for champions who scale well with IE and crits (35 extra AD trumps the Botrk on hit below 1000 health), and the cdr/mana regen is still a damage increase for any spellslinger.

Getting forbidden idol before the pickaxe and vamp scepter is highly highly unlikely, since even AD casters have most of their power locked up in auto-attacks and AD ratios. The extra spam you get from idol is likely to seriously lose out to lower life steal, lower autoattack damage, and lower AD ratios, so you're either building like a normal carry and getting pickaxe/scepter or you're killing your ability to trade so you can spam a little more often.

but forbidden Idol is only 700 gold.
If you return with 1600 gold you can afford both FI and PickAxe.
And with 2250 gold BF+Forbidden idol.
Is not THAT expensive to push back their builds, it just lowers their AD ratio, but early game most of the damage comes from spells base damage anyway.

And with 1600 gold your enemy gets twice as much attack damage and begins to force trades. Your power spike at 2250 is cheaper than the BF/pickaxe by ~300g I think, but you also have nothing to build into immediately afterwards.

If you don't think it's expensive, I seriously recommend testing this in bot games and watching how your DPS changes. Losing out on autos *and* ratios is a big deal, especially when you're level 4-6.

Well, actually with bots is the only place where BF sword is more effective.
See, bots don't actually dodge spells, or force you to use spell defensively, so you waste less mana.
Sure, you have 20 AD less, and that's huge for autoattacks, but in term of AD ratios that's not that big, and the extra damage you can land with the extra mana can easily compensate.
Just an example. 

Forbidden Idol restores 480 mana over 5 minutes.
For a Pantheon, those are 10 extra casts of Spear Shot.
Which are 2250 physical damage.
The loss in damage from AD ratio is 280.
And 20 for each AA landed, ofc.

My friend, you need more experience with bots. Bots have an automatic spell-detection system that makes them dodge skill shots quite well. They also can go very aggressive if they are even close to executing you, and their instant reaction times make defensive spellcasting and sustain very important. They are also super easy to trick and gank, but that's another story.

In your first example the player has 20 AD less, which can translate to 30 less damage for AD casters like Graves and Varus (the ones who want ER). That's really big when shoving a lane, stealing objectives, or trying to get that last bit of damage to secure a kill.

Your example of Pantheon really doesn't work. You need to sit around for 5 minutes without going too low on HP, you must save all that mana only for spear shots (no low-damage jumps), you need to be incredibly conservative with casting to last 5 minutes, a large amount of spear damage is lost to CS'ing, *and* you're still losing trades so you're less likely to be able to hang around for 5 minutes. A pantheon will be much better off picking up raw AD and ArPen so he can assassinate like he's supposed to.

EDIT: Damn, I forgot to mention the lost sustain and objective pressure.

It doesn't matter if you are losing 20 or 30 damage from AD ratios when you are throwing 5 extra spells that you wouldn't have used otherwise and that hit as hard as 230-300 damage EACH.

Especially for shoving a lane.
Especially for objective pressure.
The only thing that would be a drawback is that you are losing damage against turrets, but even then, having extra spell casts make your waveclear much better.

Of course in a 1v1 All-in Brutalizer would deal more damage.
That's why sustain is sustain, and damage is damage.
The fact that  a champion loses equal trades when one has picked sustain and his opponent damage is fair, as long as the first champion ends up with more mana to continue harassing while his enemy has only autoattacks to farm and keep the lane.
Anyway, check the other iteration made by The Djinn , introducing  a mid tier item building into Essence Reaver.

It really does matter because those extra spells come 9 seconds later and the 30 damage comes right now. When you are trying to shove a wave to the tower, you don't want to wait 9 seconds to get your second buckshot. You want to kill all the creeps, then pressure an objective. And since that's such an important part of the game, you can see why picking up FI is so bad for it.

The only thing FI has going for it is long-term waveclear, which provides very little benefit at levels 4-6 (when you get it).

A brutalizer also provides better HP sustain if you have a Dblade, the ability to win trades in any scenario (1v1 or otherwise), better kill potential when roaming, and stronger harassment from individual spells. And remember that having high mana for repeated harass isn't useful if your HP is too low to in range anyways, which is what's likely to happen if you stick around losing trades for *5 whole minutes*. That spear shot is basically begging someone to use their gap-closer on you.

The middle-ground ER substitute that Djinn and many other have proposed is actually reasonable. This iteration is just crazy wrong, which is why I commented.

@MasterOfTheOrder: Ah, so the problem is you don't know what a damage spike is. A damage spike is where a given instance of damage increases. In LoL, that is caused by ability ratios (AD, AP, mana, usually) or increased base damage when using an ability. For example, Varus's Q deals 15 / 70 / 125 / 180 / 235 (+ 160% AD), where the numbers with slashes are the base damage and the 160% AD is the AD ratio. So increasing the rank of the spell or increasing the AD ratio gives him a "damage spike".

Varus's Q also costs mana and has a cooldown. Getting FI increases your mregen and decreases your cooldowns, so he can spam Q more often, but it doesn't increase his damage. That is why it doesn't provide a damage spike.

Adding a {{item:3114}} to the recipe would have the mana restoration and CDR make a lot more sense, but I don't think it entirely solves the item's problems: {{item:3508}} is made to solve mana issues on AD champions, but whereas marksmen are mostly focused on late-game power, mana problems are most prevalent during laning and aren't really an issue later on. The current Essence Reaver falls flat because it doesn't provide its bonus in time, but the Essence Reaver you're suggesting is slot inefficient compared to any {{item:1038}} item, particularly {{item:3072}} (the mana regen won't carry well into the late game for marksmen, and having the mana restoration scale with lifesteal in general and in such a way is redundant). Seeing as they're competing for the same niche (sustain), the Essence Reaver you propose would still be underpicked.

I think the idea here would be to have the item build from a path in a manner similar to {{item:3153}}, with an easy build path leading to an AD-oriented mana sustain item (Idol is a great item, but on most AD champions, even casters that benefit a lot from the CDR, it'd delay their damage output too much to be taken over other items at similar prices), which would then build up to a slot-efficient Essence Reaver that, on top of the mana sustain, would have an effect that would ensure late-game slot efficiency, enough for it to rival the Bloodthirster but with enough of a tradeoff to not be mandatory on every marksman.

I've actually been considering shifting it to 40 AD + 40% AS over a flat AD, keep it from occupying the same niche as BT which would allow it to be made more slot efficient.

I'd like to remind you the definition of a TRADE OFF, though. Yeah, they'd have to delay their damage if they want an early Forbidden Idol. But they don't HAVE to buy it. That's the beauty of the component system.

There can definitely be a tradeoff to the item while still allowing for a smooth damage curve. {{item:3144}} , for example, is an item that's awesome to buy and gives a ton of good stats, plus a great active, but sacrifices about 20 AD for that slow and sustain. Similarly, if you had an item that gave you 25 AD and 10% CDR, plus the mana restoration active, at a price similar to that of Cutlass, you'd end up with similar tradeoffs (a lot less than a {{item:1038}} 's worth of AD for a comparable amount of gold in exchange for other goodies).

I think this is the right idea. Forget a forbidden idol, even it makes sense stat-wise. You need a new item that sits at the halfway point and actually helps with mana costs before the full item build but also doesn't completely sacrifice damage at the same time. Something with AD and mana regen both at least.

A lifesteal item with ad and as, that really wouldn'T fill a similar niche as an already existing item...o wait, we have{{item:3153}} !

Also, why would i want that item? as an ad-caster, i want ad, cdr and arpen, not as.
As an AA-focused champ, i don'T need mana nor cdr.
So who exactly would want it?

Also, with the curretn BT giving twice as much lifesteal and the shield, it obviously fills a diffrent niche than the cdr+mana from Essenc Reaver.
Essence reaver would shine on casterlike carrys, BT gives far more use to AA-reliant carrys due to the high sustain it offers, and it would be an option for survivabillity, as the shield mostly means ~400aditional hp.

So u have the choice between some healthsustain, some mana sustain and cdr, or huge health sustain and shield, both offering pros and cons.
therefore i don't see BT and ER occpying the same niche. They are similar, but still offer enougth unique power to alow decisionmakeing.
Just like locked, Banshies and SV, all give a similar amount of mr and health but different aditional effeckts allowing choices to be made.

ER vs BotRK is Mana sustain vs. Health shredding, two very different niches.

ER vs BT is Mana and Health sustain vs Health sustain. **The same niche.**

"AD casters" don't exist. They're a myth. There are no AD casters who don't want AS and who use Mana other than maybe, MAYBE Pantheon, who wouldn't even use ER anyways no matter what stats it has. But you know who wants AS, CDR, and health and mana sustain? Lucian. Sivir. Ashe. Jayce. Potentially even Twitch, Vayne, Jinx, and Corki.
